entry.title: iwa: Cleaning usage of kIsolatedWebApps
entry.content:
kIsolatedWebApps should not be used as IWAs may be enabled by enterprise

policy or by the flag. By checking just kIsolatedWebApps we don't allow

to use the IWA in Managed guest session.



AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled() should be used in the browser process or

switches::kEnableIsolatedWebAppsInRenderer in a renderer process.



Bug: b/289356220

entry.title: [ios] Remove unnecessary __block annotations
entry.content:
Marking a member field with __block is unnecessary (since the block

will always capture `this` to access the member field) so it can be

removed.



Marking a local variable with __block is unnecessary when there is

no block in the scope where the variable is accessible (since no

block can capture it) so it can be removed.



Bug: none

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Fix startup session adoption for Chrome datasources
entry.content:
Tracing service fails to adopt a startup tracing session when its

config doesn't match the service config exactly. This can prevent

Chrome datasources from starting in child processes.



This CL provides a custom config comparator for Chrome datasources

that are registered via PerfettoTracedProcess::DataSourceProxy to correctly adopt sessions in this case.

entry.title: Reland "[ProfileSelections] Transition extension keyed factories to use Profile Selections"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit f93ee8bbfe4108f5cce0beb322142d5332a864bf



Original change's description:

> [ProfileSelections] Transition extension keyed factories to use Profile Selections

>

> Make sure that all extension factories (that do not use the

> BrowserContextKeyedAPI) use the Profile Selection logic through the

> ExtensionBrowserClient to have more control over different profile

> types.

> Mainly so that it stops being able to indirectly create services for the

> System Profile and be able to easily control the creation for the Guest

> Profile through the force variable.

>

> Changes:

> - `GetOriginalContext()` --> `GetContextRedirectedToOriginal()`

> - `context` --> `GetContextOwnInstance()`

> - no implementation --> `GetContextForOriginalOnly()`

>

> These changes will indirectly cause those services not to be able to be

> created for the System Profile, and the creation for the Guest Profile

> will be dependant on the `force_guest_profile` variable.

>

> Also added protections to some stacks in extensions to return early in

> case of System Profile (Extensions are disabled in the System Profile).

entry.title: Add web-app-internals page to allowlist so Ash version is accessible
entry.content:
When lacros is the primary/only browser (using flags #lacros-primary or

#lacros-only), regular web apps are managed by Lacros but system web

apps are managed by Ash. So chrome://web-app-internals shows regular web

app info and os://web-app-internals shows system web app info.



This CL allows os://web-app-internals to open the Ash version.

entry.content:
The Docs service worker gets registered when navigating to

docs.google.com along with all the other DSS service workers. This

functionality is required to fix an edge case where users may not have

visited docs.google.com before going offline. This enables for both

LaCrOS and Ash.

entry.title: [wasm] Simplify handling of streaming errors
entry.content:
This reverts an attempt to fix DCHECK errors we saw in the wild. The

actual fix was https://crrev.com/c/4654310.



As documented on {BeginRead} and {EndRead}, the {kErrored} status should

only be returned when in an errored state. In closed state, {kDone} will

be returned.

entry.title: [Lacros Payments] Make payment dialog an overlay over TWA window.
entry.content:
This CL updates the code to make the invoked payment dialog an overlay

over TWA window for Lacros.



To attach the payment dialog to the TWA window, overlay manager needs

to know which window the TWA is running in, in Lacros, we do not have

this information, because windows are running in Ash, and Ash doesn't

know about the web contents running in Lacros.



To track where the app instances are running, instance_id was used to

represent each TWA instance running in Lacros. This instance id is

mapped to each TWA's corresponding web contents in

BrowserAppInstanceTracker in Lacros, and mapped to the window the TWA

is running at in AppService InstanceRegistry in Ash.



This uses the instance id to associate the payment request

with a specific app instance, so that Ash can identify the app window,

so that Ash can put the ARC payment dialog overlay on the TWA window.





BUG=1385989



Change-Id: If6a22f5f93d14b7c77bb79f47ecf6f91fefcaa92

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Fetch handler fallback with redirections
entry.content:
This CL fixes crash bugs caused by CHECK in

ServiceWorkerResourceLoader::SetCommitResponsibility().



Basically SetCommitResponsibility should be called once, since the race

winner (network or fetch handler) takes the rest of processes. However,

it can be tricky if the response is redirect, and the fetch handler

result is a fallback.



Redirect response is basically handled by the fetch handler, even when

the RaceNetworkRequest gets the first response. This was introduced in

crrev.com/c/4680667



On the other hand, if the fetch handler result is a fallback, we ask

RaceNetworkRequest side to handle the response not to dispatch an

additional request as a fallback[1].



If those two conditions are combined, SetCommitResponsibility() can be

called twice. Specifically, below cases:



Case 1: Fetch handler wins the race.

1. `OnFallback()` is called, set `kWithoutServiceWorker`

2. Then `OnReceiveRedirect()`, set `kServiceWorker`



This hits DCHECK.



Case 2: RaceNetworkRequest redirect response comes first.

1. `OnReceiveRedirect()` is called, set `kServiceWorker`

2. `OnFallback()` is called, start the fallback request.



This case, the data pipe is not closed, and the fallback request is

called twice.





Case 3: Fetch handler starts handling first then RaceNetworkRequest



This is not related to the fallback, but related to the redirect.



1. `DidDispatchFetchEvent()` is called, set `kServiceWorker`.

2. `OnReceiveRedirect()` is called, set `kServiceWorker`.



This hits DCHECK.



This CL addresses each case.



Case 1: If the fetch handler fallback result comes first, that means the

fetch handler is already completed, hence the data pipe to SW is already

closed. We handle the redirect process on RaceNetworkSide.



Case 2: We actively close the data pipe, and dispatch the fallback

request on the renderer process which is the default fallback path. It

costs additional network request, but we have no good solution for now.



Case 3:: We don't call SetCommitResponsibility() twice.





[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/renderer/service_worker/service_worker_subresource_loader.cc;l=606-611?q=serviceworkersubresourceloader



Bug: 1466376, 1464914

Change-Id: I535eedf9c9840ce2c9ed8049e6e73711a182226c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4706744

Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173363}

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Update test mock server behavior
entry.content:
The mock server for BestEffortServiceWorker tests behaves differently

based on request params. In this CL, below params are related:



1. server_redirect: Returns the redirect response to the client.

2. server_slow: Returns the delayed response.



Currently when both parameters are attached to the request,

`server_redirect` is prioritized, which means the first response is not

delayed. This behavior introduces some test flakiness on the tests

including redirections, we occasionally get unexpected race results

between the network request and fetch handler on some platforms.



After this CL the delayed response will be returned even if the response

is a redirect response, that behavior stabilize the current tests.



Change-Id: I93a9e74e2f28b0542efe306f27bfc21877ede373

Bug: 1464914, 1431421

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4703448

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Fix test js not correctly waiting
entry.content:
Noticed ServiceWorker JavaScript for BestEffortServiceWorker tests doesn't run as expected. Specifically, when we run the test checking the fetch handler fallback case with the delayed response, the fetch handler immediately completes the execution without any delay. This is because fetch handler doesn't care if the promise is resolved or not, but only care if respondWith is called or not to return the result to the client.



Updated the test code to wait synchronously with a while loop.



Bug: 1464914

entry.title: [wei] Ensure Origin Trial enables full feature
entry.content:
This CL moves the base::Feature from content_features.h to

a generated feature from runtime_enabled_features.json5.



This means that the base::Feature can be default-enabled

while the web API is controlled by the RuntimeFeature, which will

still be default-disabled.



An origin trial can enable the RuntimeFeature, which will

allow full access to the API, provided the base::Feature is also

enabled (see change to origin_trial_context.cc).



Meanwhile, the base::Feature can be disabled through Finch as a

kill-switch for the whole feature, and prevent origin trials

from turning the feature on.



Tests have been added to WebView test, as it allowed for easy

spoofing of responses on a known origin.



Bug: 1439945

Change-Id: Ifa0f5d4f5e0a0bf882dd1b0207698dddd6f71420

Fixed: b/278701736

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681552

Reviewed-by: Rayan Kanso

Commit-Queue: Peter Pakkenberg

entry.title: Wait processing service worker events until the top-level script is evaluated
entry.content:
We noticed that the following events can be queued before evaluating the

service worker top-level script.



- DispatchFetchEventForMainResource

- DispatchFetchEventForSubresource



This is because these events don't wait for the service worker top-level

script evaluation. Instead, these APIs send fetch events via mojo API

for better fetch performance without waiting for the proper startup.



On the other hand, top-level script evaluation has to wait for the

following conditions.



- ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::InitializeGlobalScope() is called.

- ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsManager becomes ready to provide the

top-level script if the script is already installed.



Before this CL, DispatchFetchEventForMainResource and

DispatchFetchEventForSubresource didn't wait for the

ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsManager. The fetch events are immediately

triggered before the top-level script is evaluated. This CL modifies the

ServiceWorkerEventQueue so that we can accumulate the events in the

queue until the top-level script is evaluated. Immediately after the

top-level script is evaluated, ServiceWorkerEventQueue::Start() runs,

and the accumulated events will be processed.



This CL starts waiting for ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsManager. But at

the same time, we don't want to wait for

ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsManager too long. If the service worker

initialization takes too long, https://crrev.com/c/4703983 stops the

service worker when it is timed out.



The relationship between this CL and https://crbug.com/1462568 is not

clear yet. The current assumption is that

DispatchFetchEventForMainResource and DispatchFetchEventForSubresource

start ServiceWorkerEventQueue's idle_callback_handle_ timer before the

top-level script is evaluated (as a side effect). If the service worker

script wasn't loaded within 30 seconds (idle timeout), the idle timeout

happens on a warmed-up service worker, and it is treated as an invalid

termination request.



This CL also removes

ServiceWorkerEventQueueTest.EventFinishedBeforeStart. This test was

written on the assumption that ServiceWorkerEventQueue should run events

before ServiceWorkerEventQueue::Start() runs. But this means that we

allow running fetch events before top-level script evaluation. I think

this was a wrong assumption.



Bug: 1462568

Bug: 1431792

Change-Id: Ia5c65e2062e6de2eb11fda65bed212f854e6ee99

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4686632

Reviewed-by: Shunya Shishido

Commit-Queue: Minoru Chikamune

Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173343}

entry.title: Introduce feature param for limiting disk data allocator capacity
entry.content:
This CL adds a feature param named 'max_disk_capacity_mb'

of 'CompressParkableStrings' blink feature. This param

limits maximum capacity of disk data allocator per

renderer process. We can use this param usefully when

an environment has limited swap space.

If this param enabled, total written data for ParkableString

and ParkableImage will not be exceeded to a given limitation.

entry.title: Visual debugger tracing implementation
entry.content:
This change makes all visual debug positional logs now possibly trace

events when the visual debugger runtime is disabled.



The default behavior remains the same but if the macro

"DBG_USE_VIZ_DEBUGGER_TRACE() 1" is defined at the time of call-site

invocation the draw call will result in a trace.



This CL also merges the 'DrawRect' and 'DrawText' operations into one

single type everywhere.

entry.title: Don't crash when HTMLPopoverAttribute is manually disabled
entry.content:
The MediaControlPopupMenuElement was converted [1] to use the

Popover API after HTMLPopoverAttribute was shipped by default [2].

However, there are {D}CHECKs that make sure popover features

are only used when the feature is enabled. This means that on

systems with the HTMLPopoverAttribute feature manually disabled,

these CHECKs will get hit. For now, at least don't crash. The

popover will still not function. But this is a short term patch

until the Popover feature flag is removed completely on August

8, 2023.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4204913

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4206587



Fixed: 1466192

Change-Id: Ibbd7a66b678df35bd183a00971611a9d45e6fa9e

entry.title: Exo: Adjust host window subpixel to fix root surface position
entry.content:
This CL sets subpixel position offset for host window layer explicitly.

Root surface should stay in the same position even with decimal rounding

but it does not in the current code when the host window origin is

floored.

This issue was hidden until now since root_surface_origin() is always

zero without clip delegation.



This CL also adds UpdateSurfaceBounds when size is the same but the

origin has changed since we need to adjust subpixel.



This cl does not affect the behavior now since root_surface_origin() is

always zero without `quad_within_window` guard removal.



Bug: 1457447, 1385509

entry.title: mediarecorder: Add correct AV1 codecs string "av01"
entry.content:
MediaRecorder uses the wrong AV1 codecs string, "av1." The correct

one is "av01" [1] This CL adds the correct one. We don't remove

the wrong codecs string in this CL for backward-compatibility.

Instead we will remove it once we confirm nobody uses it in product through the UMA, Media.MediaRecorder.AV1CodecsStr.



[1] https://aomediacodec.github.io/av1-isobmff/#codecsparam

entry.title: Remove @VisibleForTesting from ForTesting methods
entry.content:
and disable the related lint check. The lint check fails because

it does not recognize that a "ForTest" method without the annotation

is allowed to call other @VisibleForTesting methods (e.g. those

without the ForTesting suffix).



Not using the annotation for ForTesting methods was recently added to

the style guide (0872aad0a7fd3ef7c5a8444d60e4ae0ea4b03c7c).



This fixing existing violations. I used the following script:



import re

import sys

C = open(sys.argv[1], encoding='utf8').read()

if '@VisibleForTesting' in C:

C = re.sub(r' +@VisibleForTesting.*\n(\s+.*ForTest\S*\()', r'\1', C)

open(sys.argv[1], mode='w', encoding='utf8').write(C)



Bug: None

Change-Id: I80c695d48425ce639feb4184ecd1f4c82d0f7903

No-Try: True

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705304

Reviewed-by: Yaron Friedman

Owners-Override: Andrew Grieve

entry.title: Disable use_webgpu_mailbox_texture for nullptr Source Color Space
entry.content:
Using webgpu mailbox texture with source color space info discarded (e.g. ImageBitmapcreated with "ColorSpaceConversion: 'none'") caused premultiplied alpha issue.

Details here:https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1457649#c9



Set use_webgpu_mailbox_texture = false to workaround this case.

entry.title: arc/gio: Code refactor on manager and touch injector
entry.content:
This CL:

- adds content_bounds_f() to return float value of bounds and

content_bounds() to return integer value of bounds for TouchInjector.

- renames the function from OnActionUpdated() to

OnActionInputBindingUpdated() to make it more clear.

NotifyActionUpdated is changed to NotifyActionInputBindingChanged as

well.

- removes the `beta_` member in class and gets the current version from

static function to make the code consistent.

entry.content:
Add Cancel button so users can cancel the upload to Cloud flow via the

upload progress notification.



The Cancel button will call the Upload Handler's cancel_callback_.



If a small upload to Drive (Copy IO task + Sync to Drive) has completed

before the upload progress notification has been shown for the minimum

time, the Cancel button is removed from the notification as it is too

late to click it.

entry.title: extensions: don't rely on content notifications to invalidate CRX cache
entry.content:
On ChromeOS, there exists an external cache of CRX files for extensions.

The class responsible for maintaining that cache (ExternalCacheImpl)

needs to remove entries from it when installs fail, since that usually

indicates the CRX is invalid. That was previously done using a content

notification; this change reimplements that behavior using

InstallTracker instead.



Change-Id: I98dc70620f4e3f9b057537cdcb7f16924b6cbad2

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Add selected text colors.
entry.content:
In non-high-contrast mode, selected and unselected suggestions have

similar backgrounds (e.g. light gray and white in light mode), and their

text colors are the same (e.g. black in light mode).



In high-contrast mode, selected and unselected suggestions have

different backgrounds (e.g. black and white), and their text colors need

to swap (e.g. white and black).



Therefore, some text color tokens have a unselected and a selected

variant. E.g. URL blues have tokens `kColorOmniboxResultsUrl` &

`kColorOmniboxResultsUrlSelected`.



Currently, cr23 updates the unselected tokens to cr23 colors, but

doesn't touch the selected tokens. This leads to some suggestions using

the old colors, while some use the new colors - even when not in

high-contrast mode.



This CL updates the selected tokens to be equal to the unselected

tokens. This is correct behavior when not in high-contrast mode, but not

in high-contrast mode; but that's ok since cr23 isn't applied when in

high-contrast mode.



There's also an existing bug where some of the selected colors are

applied to the default suggestion instead of the selected suggestion. We

should probably address this when expanding cr23 to high-contrast mode.

entry.content:
Restore "quicker" tab strip reordering.

animation must finish before the next reorder event is initiated.

Instead, attempting to reorder past another tab should complete the

previous tab reorder animation and immediately initiate the next

reorder event.

entry.title: Fix some Textfield touch selection dragging polish bugs.
entry.content:
1. Currently the touch selection magnifier initially appears in the

wrong spot when touch dragging the cursor in a views::Textfield. Move

the cursor on drag begin (rather than only on drag updates) to fix

this.



2. Also destroy the Textfield's touch selection controller before cursor

dragging or long press selection dragging to prevent the touch

handles from initially appearing in the wrong spot. (This also makes

things more consistent with how the touch handles are shown/hidden

entry.title: NoCopyBack: Store margin data in NGPhysicalBoxFragments
entry.content:
Margins are stored as PhysicalFragmentRareData::RareField.



Before this CL, margins for a box were:

A) Set by `NGBlockNode::UpdateMarginPaddingInfoIfNeeded()` for

any blocks, and

B) Overwritten by a container algorithm with `NGBoxFragmentBuilder::

AddResult()`



This CL updates them to store margins in PhysicalFragmentRareData.



* Introduce MutableForContainerLayout class to mutate a physical box

fragment.

It's similar to existing MutableForPainting and MutableForCloning.

We can instantiate MutableForContainerLayout only in the

kInPerformLayout phase.



* NGBlockNode::UpdateMarginPaddingInfoIfNeeded() adds margins to the

fragment.

* NGBoxFragmentBuilder::AddResult() adds margins to a child fragment.



* LayoutBox::MarginBoxOutsets() gets margins from the first physical

fragment.



* Adjust tests for the kInPerformLayout requirement.



This CL should have no behavior changes.

entry.title: extensions: de-flake ExternalProviderImpl tests
entry.content:
Some of these tests are loading multiple extensions in parallel. Once

they have started the parallel extension loads, they wait for one to

have loaded, then assert that it has the right ID (kStandaloneAppId).

This *usually* works, because kStandaloneAppId is the first extension

that the tests start loading, but it occasionally doesn't, because

extension loading is asynchronous and parallelized.



To fix that, this change has the ExternalProviderImpl tests wait for the

actual extension they are expecting a load of; that way, the tests

assert what they truly want to check (that the target extension loads)

without accidentally asserting that that load completes before the other

extensions that are being loaded.



Fixed: 1457039

Change-Id: I2170c001fd3fa3d50148f4e282491cff75f957a0

entry.title: [infra] Reconfigure ownership for //infra/config files.
entry.content:
Before the *.pyl files were generated from starlark, anyone could make

changes to the *.pyl files with the owner requirement satisfied so long

as they had a approval from an owner for any .json files that were

modified as a result. With the move to generating these files from

starlark files, that has regressed because //infra/config/targets

doesn't have an OWNERS file, so it uses the //infra/config OWNERS, which

doesn't enable the various *.json owners to make changes to the

definitions.



In anticipation of the .json files being generated by starlark in the

future, the OWNERS file in //infra/config/generated has been updated so

that files that aren't currently being generated won't be owner by

everyone. This will prevent someone from being able to modify one of the

files in //infra/config/targets that modifies the resulting targets spec

.json files without requiring an actual owner review.



Bug: 1456553

entry.title: [Tab Strip] Fix MSB not aligned when TSR Disabled
entry.content:
- Also fix NTB is slightly off when MSB is visible



The culprit CL is https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4261062, where we unintendedly changed the MSB x-position for TSR disabled.



The correct MSB x-position when TSR disabled:

NTB(24dp) | 24dp | MSB(24dp) | 12dp



The wrong MSB x-position when TSR disabled because of the culprit CL:

NTB(24dp) | 8dp | MSB(24dp) | 24dp



There are two places where we set the paddings incorrectly:

1. in StripLayoutHelperManager#onSizeChanged, we incorrectly applied twice(12dp * 2) the padding between MSB and strip end by calling #getModelSelectorButtonWidthWithPadding. For control, this method should only be called when setting NTB end margin(e.g in #updateModelSwitcherButton()) , because we need to apply bigger padding(24dp) between MSB and NTB in control.



2. With 1 being said, in StripLayoutHelper#setEndMargin, we shouldn't apply NEW_TAB_BUTTON_WITH_MODEL_SELECTOR_BUTTON_PADDING(8dp) for control, this padding should only be used for TSR. And the margin passed from #updateModelSwitcherButton() should already account for padding between MSB and NTB, so we only need to apply NewTabButtonWithTabStripEndPadding.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/96FmHRZEuxoGe7n

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BpbzuHAf4U8KzzQ
